name: Flickr Downloader
tagline: Save Flickr images and content instantly to your device.
description:
Flickr Downloader gives creators and teams a dependable way to save Flickr images and content instantly to your device. Instead of juggling manual captures or questionable browser extensions, it pulls content directly from Flickr with consistent quality and predictable results.

It supports High-res Flickr downloads and albums, Batch photographer portfolios/collections downloads, and Creative Commons and rights-managed content, so you can move quickly from download to delivery without tedious rework. Use it to archive Flickr assets, prep client deliverables, or keep your library accessible when connectivity is limited.
seo_description: Download Flickr images and graphics for offline use. Fast and reliable Flickr content downloader.
features: Bandwidth management for large photo collections
Backup & restore options for photo archives

faqs.question: How do I use the Flickr downloader?
faqs.answer: Install the browser extension, navigate to Flickr, find the content you want to download, and click the download button that appears. The content will be saved to your chosen location.

faqs.question: What quality options are available?
faqs.answer: The downloader supports all available quality levels from Flickr, ranging from standard definition up to 4K or higher where available. You can select your preferred quality before downloading.

faqs.question: Does this work with all Flickr content?
faqs.answer: The downloader works with most publicly accessible content on Flickr. Some restricted or DRM-protected content may not be downloadable.

faqs.question: Will downloads continue if my internet connection drops?
faqs.answer: If your connection is interrupted, you may need to restart the download. However, for most content, downloads complete quickly enough that interruptions are rare.

faqs.question: Is there a download limit?
faqs.answer: There are no artificial download limits imposed by the extension. You can download as much content as your storage space allows, one item at a time.

faqs.question: How do I organize my downloaded content?
faqs.answer: Downloaded files are saved to your selected folder. You can organize them manually using your computer's file system, creating folders by date, topic, or any system that works for you.

faqs.question: Does this work on all browsers?
faqs.answer: The extension works on major desktop browsers including Chrome, Firefox, and Edge. Make sure your browser is up to date for the best compatibility.

faqs.question: Is my data kept private?
faqs.answer: Yes, the extension operates entirely on your local device. No download history or personal data is sent to external servers, ensuring complete privacy.

reviews.name: Alex Martinez
reviews.review: I manage content libraries and Flickr Downloader lets me pull everything from Flickr in minutes. The speeds are great and files stay organized.
reviews.title: Saves hours every week with Flickr Downloader

reviews.name: Jamie Nguyen
reviews.review: Downloading from Flickr used to be hit or miss. This downloader is stable, fast, and the quality is always on point.
reviews.title: Rock solid Flickr downloads

reviews.name: Priya Patel
reviews.review: We archive Flickr assets for clients and the download in Flickr Downloader keep our workflows smooth. Totally worth the price.
reviews.title: Ideal for organizing Flickr content
